      • pow

        public static double pow(double arg0,
         long power)
        A much faster, simpler way of raising a number to an exponent than Math.pow. Note: The obvious limitation is the required integer exponent
        Parameters:
        arg0 - a number raised to the 'power'
        power - nth power
        Returns:
        the first argument raised to the power of the second argument.

      • round

        public static double round(double arg0,
           int n)
        Returns the given double value rounded to n decimal places.
        Note: the current precision setting of the DoubleMath class does NOT affect the result of this method.
        Parameters:
        arg0 - the double value to round
        n - the scale (number of places) to which the double should be rounded
        Returns:

      • setPrecision

        public static void setPrecision(int precision)
        Sets the math precision value for floating point numbers.
        Parameters:
        precision - number of places to the right of the decimal to round.

      • getPrecision

        public static int getPrecision()
        Default is 9 decimal places.
        Returns:
        precision - number of places to right of the decimal to round
